meanings.definition: A heap of things laid or lying one on top of another.
meanings.sent1: I saw a pile of books on the table.
meanings.sent2: The leaves were gathered into a neat pile in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a cozy nest in the pile of fallen leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were a pile of tangled thoughts, hard to sort through.
meanings.sent5: The pile of colorful candies looked tempting and delicious.

meanings.definition: A large building or group of buildings.
meanings.sent1: The office complex was a massive pile of glass and steel.
meanings.sent2: The ancient castle stood tall as a majestic pile of stones.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house was just a spooky pile of bricks to scare visitors.
meanings.sent4: The skyscraper was a towering pile of floors reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The shopping mall was a bustling pile of shops and restaurants.

meanings.sent1: There was a pile of laundry waiting to be washed.
meanings.sent2: She had a pile of work to finish before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a pile of spices to the simmering soup.
meanings.sent4: His plate was a pile of food, almost too much to finish.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was filled with a glittering pile of gold coins.
